public final class MIDIDevice
extends MIDIObject

Implements the MIDIDeviceRef as defined in MIDIServices.h

Method Detail

getNumberOfDevices

public static int getNumberOfDevices()
The number of MIDI devices in the system

CoreAudio::MIDIGetNumberOfDevices()

Returns:
the number of devices in the system, or 0 if an error occurred.

getDevice

public static MIDIDevice getDevice(int deviceIndex0)
Get one of the devices in the system As an Iterator through the devices and entities in the system, it will not ever visit any virtual sources and destinations created by other clients. Clients should prefer endpoint.getNumberOfSources(), MIDIEndpoint.getSource(), MIDIEndpoint.getNumberOfDestinations() and MIDIEndpoint.getDestination() to iterating through devices/entities/endpoints.

CoreAudio::MIDIGetDevice()

Parameters:
deviceIndex0 - The index (0...MIDIGetNumberOfDevices()-1) of the device to return
Returns:
A device in the system
Throws:
on - invalid device

getNumberOfExternalDevices

public static int getNumberOfExternalDevices()
External MIDI devices are MIDI devices connected to endpoints via a standard MIDI cable. Their presence is completely optional, only when a UI somewhere adds them.

New for CoreMIDI 1.1.



CoreAudio::MIDIGetNumberOfExternalDevices()

Returns:
The number of external devices in the system, or 0 if an error occurred.

getExternalDevice

public static MIDIDevice getExternalDevice(int deviceIndex0)
                                    throws CAException
Use this to enumerate the external devices in the system.

New for CoreMIDI 1.1.



CoreAudio::MIDIGetExternalDevice()

Parameters:
deviceIndex0 - The index (0...MIDIGetNumberOfDevices()-1) of the device to return.
Returns:
A reference to a device.
Throws:
CAException

Return the number of entities in a given device

CoreAudio::MIDIDeviceGetNumberOfEntities()

the number of entities the device contains, or 0 if an error occurred.
